protocol.text: Roots of 18 individual plants were harvested 16h and 22h after the beginning of the inductive 22-h LD and pooled. Sampling at the same times in 8-h SD happened during the dark period and were performed under dim green light. Roots were stored at -80°C until used.

). Nutrient solution was a mix of commercial stocks (0.5 ml l-1 FloraMicro, FloraGro and FloraBloom;

protocol.text: Tissues were ground in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was extracted with TRizol according to manufacturer’s instructions (www.lifetechnologies.com).  The quality of the RNA samples was assessed using the Experion(tm) automated electrophoresis system (www.bio-rad.com). All samples used for microarray analysis had an RNA quality indicator (RQI) of 10.
The RNA samples were labeled using 3’ IVT Expressed kit according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Affymetrix, www.affymetrix.com).

15 µg of fragmented cRNA was used in a 300-µl hybridization mixture containing added hybridization controls. 200 µl was hybridized on arrays for 16 h at 45°C. Standard post-hybridization wash and double-stain protocols (EukGE-WS2v5_450) were used on an Affymetrix GeneChip Fluidics Station 450. ATH1 GeneChip hybridizations, were performed by the GIGA Genomics facility (GIGA, University of Liège, Belgium).
protocol.type: nucleic acid hybridization to array protocol

protocol.text: Three biological replicates obtained from independent experiments were hybridized on ATH1 Genome arrays (Affymetrix).The array scanning were performed by the GIGA Genomics facility (GIGA, University of Liège, Belgium), using a GeneChip® Scanner 3000 7G (Affymetrix).
protocol.type: array scanning and feature extraction protocol

protocol.text: Bioinformatic analyses were performed using R programming language (R Core Team). We analysed raw microarray (“.CEL”  les) data using the limma package (Ritchie et al., 2015). Data were GCRMA-normalized, and probesets were  filtered for an absolute expression level of at least 100 in ≥ 20 % of the arrays. We  fitted the data to a linear model using the ebayes() function and corrected the p-value for multiple testing using Benjamini and Hochberg’s method (Benjamini and Hochberg, 1995). We considered genes as being differentially expressed when the adjusted p-value was ≤ 0.01 and fold change ≥ 2.
